## Variables

### DefaultMaxUsesToExplore {#ab90cfa3cc4beb814657c52b79b07c12e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>cl::opt&lt; unsigned &gt; DefaultMaxUsesToExplore(&quot;capture-tracking-max-uses-to-explore&quot;, cl::Hidden, cl::desc(&quot;Maximal number of uses to explore.&quot;), cl::init(100))</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
The default value for MaxUsesToExplore argument.

It&#39;s relatively small to keep the cost of analysis reasonable for clients like BasicAliasAnalysis, where the results can&#39;t be cached. TODO: we should probably introduce a caching CaptureTracking analysis and use it where possible. The caching version can use much higher limit or don&#39;t have this cap at all.

Definition at line <a href="#l00047">47</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/capturetracking-cpp">CaptureTracking.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This file contains routines that help determine which pointers are captured.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// A pointer value is captured if the function makes a copy of any part of the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// pointer that outlives the call.  Not being captured means, more or less, that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the pointer is only dereferenced and not stored in a global.  Returning part</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// of the pointer as the function return value may or may not count as capturing</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the pointer, depending on the context.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/capturetracker/#a684899edefe864cb9411de38e995986c"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/capturetracker/#a684899edefe864cb9411de38e995986c">CaptureTracker::isDereferenceableOrNull</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;O, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout">DataLayout</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We want comparisons to null pointers to not be considered capturing,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// but need to guard against cases like gep(p, -ptrtoint(p2)) == null,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// which are equivalent to p == p2 and would capture the pointer.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// A dereferenceable pointer is a case where this is known to be safe,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// because the pointer resulting from such a construction would not be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// dereferenceable.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// It is not sufficient to check for inbounds GEP here, because GEP with</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// zero offset is always inbounds.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> CanBeNull, CanBeFreed;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Only find pointer captures which happen before the given instruction. Uses</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Find the &#39;earliest&#39; instruction before which the pointer is known not to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><Highlight kind="comment">/// be captured. Here an instruction A is considered earlier than instruction</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><Highlight kind="comment">/// B, if A dominates B. If 2 escapes do not dominate each other, the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><Highlight kind="comment">/// terminator of the common dominator is chosen. If not all uses cannot be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><Highlight kind="comment">/// analyzed, the earliest escape is set to the first instruction in the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><Highlight kind="comment">/// function entry block.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// NOTE: Users have to make sure instructions compared against the earliest</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// escape are not in a cycle.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-capturetracking-cpp-/earliestcaptures"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-capturetracking-cpp-/earliestcaptures/#a2173e1b9b7c907c560fa9326b2a2352c">EarliestCaptures</a> : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/capturetracker">CaptureTracker</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-capturetracking-cpp-/earliestcaptures/#a2173e1b9b7c907c560fa9326b2a2352c"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-capturetracking-cpp-/earliestcaptures/#a2173e1b9b7c907c560fa9326b2a2352c">EarliestCaptures</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-capturetracking-cpp-/earliestcaptures/#ac2d8451c44f0a5715233dc0b677c45d0">ReturnCaptures</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-capturetracking-cpp-/earliestcaptures/#a265d5d74cfb20f6cf9146d52efe7bbfb">F</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dominatortree">DominatorTree</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-capturetracking-cpp-/earliestcaptures/#a477a5360363112d7ed2c9ba8834e36bc">DT</a>)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><Highlight kind="normal">      : <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-capturetracking-cpp-/earliestcaptures/#a477a5360363112d7ed2c9ba8834e36bc">DT</a>(<a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-capturetracking-cpp-/earliestcaptures/#a477a5360363112d7ed2c9ba8834e36bc">DT</a>), <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-capturetracking-cpp-/earliestcaptures/#ac2d8451c44f0a5715233dc0b677c45d0">ReturnCaptures</a>(<a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-capturetracking-cpp-/earliestcaptures/#ac2d8451c44f0a5715233dc0b677c45d0">ReturnCaptures</a>), <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-capturetracking-cpp-/earliestcaptures/#a265d5d74cfb20f6cf9146d52efe7bbfb">F</a>(<a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-capturetracking-cpp-/earliestcaptures/#a265d5d74cfb20f6cf9146d52efe7bbfb">F</a>) &#123;&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><Highlight kind="comment">/// PointerMayBeCaptured - Return true if this pointer value may be captured</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><Highlight kind="comment">/// by the enclosing function (which is required to exist).  This routine can</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199"><Highlight kind="comment">/// be expensive, so consider caching the results.  The boolean ReturnCaptures</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><Highlight kind="comment">/// specifies whether returning the value (or part of it) from the function</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><Highlight kind="comment">/// counts as capturing it or not.  The boolean StoreCaptures specified whether</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"><Highlight kind="comment">/// storing the value (or part of it) into memory anywhere automatically</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><Highlight kind="comment">/// counts as capturing it or not.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7912b6c9e7843ca9fd5a11e199bef617"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7912b6c9e7843ca9fd5a11e199bef617">llvm::PointerMayBeCaptured</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;V, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ReturnCaptures,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="228"><Highlight kind="comment">/// PointerMayBeCapturedBefore - Return true if this pointer value may be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="229"><Highlight kind="comment">/// captured by the enclosing function (which is required to exist). If a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="230"><Highlight kind="comment">/// DominatorTree is provided, only captures which happen before the given</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="231"><Highlight kind="comment">/// instruction are considered. This routine can be expensive, so consider</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="232"><Highlight kind="comment">/// caching the results.  The boolean ReturnCaptures specifies whether</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"><Highlight kind="comment">/// returning the value (or part of it) from the function counts as capturing</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><Highlight kind="comment">/// it or not.  The boolean StoreCaptures specified whether storing the value</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235"><Highlight kind="comment">/// (or part of it) into memory anywhere automatically counts as capturing it</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"><Highlight kind="comment">/// or not.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a3693cec8e936224ad3e5748debe73b75"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a3693cec8e936224ad3e5748debe73b75">llvm::PointerMayBeCapturedBefore</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;V, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ReturnCaptures,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="313"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the callee might return its own address.  It is analogous to saying</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00467" /><CodeLine lineNumber="467"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00468" /><CodeLine lineNumber="468"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00469" /><CodeLine lineNumber="469"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If this is an identified function-local object, check to see if it escapes.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00470" /><CodeLine lineNumber="470"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abe71bc4610a9dc7aa3a6c6e0e28fc14a">isIdentifiedFunctionLocal</a>(V)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00471" /><CodeLine lineNumber="471"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Set StoreCaptures to True so that we can assume in our callers that the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00472" /><CodeLine lineNumber="472"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// pointer is not the result of a load instruction. Currently</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00473" /><CodeLine lineNumber="473"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// PointerMayBeCaptured doesn&#39;t have any special analysis for the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00474" /><CodeLine lineNumber="474"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// StoreCaptures=false case; if it did, our callers could be refined to be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00475" /><CodeLine lineNumber="475"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// more precise.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00476" /><CodeLine lineNumber="476"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Ret = !<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7912b6c9e7843ca9fd5a11e199bef617">PointerMayBeCaptured</a>(V, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">, </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42;StoreCaptures=&#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00477" /><CodeLine lineNumber="477"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (IsCapturedCache)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00478" /><CodeLine lineNumber="478"><Highlight kind="normal">      CacheIt-&gt;second = Ret;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00479" /><CodeLine lineNumber="479"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Ret;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00480" /><CodeLine lineNumber="480"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00481" /><CodeLine lineNumber="481"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
